website_summaries.verdict: Durable build and simplicity set this watch apart from the digital models. There are fewer working mechanisms, which makes it easier to maintain.
pros: Adjustable wristband fits most wrists comfortably
Water-resistant up to 30 meters, but not suitable for swimming
Works for adults with small wrists
cons: Excessively playing with the Velcro on the strap quickly wears it out

customer_reviews.title: No INDIGLO or Waterproofing in "newer" version w/ pics
customer_reviews.text: The original watch that we purchased back in June 2014 had INDIGLO and was water proof. We repurchased the "same" watch again in April 2015 and to our surprise the INDIGLO was gone along with the water proofing (water resistant to splashed but not submersion). I've added picture of the internals for comparison. If TIMEX brings back the original TIMEX Kids watch, it would be a 5 STAR again!!!
customer_reviews.author: P@BL()

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time, came running, opened.  Not good!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd time I have purchased a timex new from Amazon and it comes opened and the battery is running. The last one I thought was a fluke...but the battery died shortly thereafter which is annoying when its supposed to be a brand new watch. This one came running and clearly opened. I cant return it because it was a lightening deal but I only spend a few bucks for it. I wont order any more timex watches here,...I just don't know why they are used and not marketed as used.
customer_reviews.author: DogsRule

customer_reviews.title: A good watch for a 9 yo but buy two since it's going to stop in one year.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third (yes, third) watch of the same type I buy and since my son really loves these I keep buying him a new one. They last about a year and stop working, either battery runs out and runs you close to 10 $ to have replaced at a store so it's almost cheaper to get a new one. The first versions had backlit display and were really great, this version does NOT have backlit (omnilight). Strap is really good and a good fit for an 8 / 9 yo. Would give this 5 stars if it still had backlight and lasted a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: Karl E. Kristjánsson

customer_reviews.title: 3 year old loves it - held up so far!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for 3 year old son birthday. It was a big hit and he wears it almost everyday. I love the velcro strap. People have inquired about the sizing. I can tell you my 3 year old is on the SMALL side. He still wears 24 month-2t clothes. And we are able to tighten this watch down enough so it perfectly sits on his wrist. We've had it 1 week and its already gone through the wash and came out working! (Momma here needs to learn to start checking pockets....).He's received a lot of compliments on it and he just beams whenever someone asks him what time it is. Overall, great buy. I'm amazed it survived the washing machine honestly.
customer_reviews.author: N. P.

customer_reviews.title: Great design-terrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: Love the watch! My 7 year old grandson will love it for Christmas. Excellent design and detailed face. He will definitely get the knack of telling time. On the negative side, Amazon Fulfillment Center used a yellow bubble envelope and put the watch in it's original packaging straight in the envelope. Unsuprisingly, the package was broken and the plastic case was broken...but the watch was fine. I half expected the crystal to be smashed. Works fine out of the box. Loving it so far. But Amazon needs to work on their packaging skills
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Broken in 6 weeks, replacement of battery did not work, returning, but, it costs 10 dollars to replace.
customer_reviews.text: It broke after 6 weeks. I replaced the battery, but not working. I am going to return it to the 100% Worry Free Replacement Plan address, but it says to send a check for "10 dollars for shipping and processing". That go me worried about the total cost of this to be almost the similar to the original price. Wait! That is not quite 100% Worry Free,..
customer_reviews.author: El Camino

customer_reviews.title: slow out of the box; died after ten days
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our seven year old son's birthday. The first one lasted six months before the battery died. I couldn't figure out how to replace the battery, so we bought another one. It ran slow straight out of the box, losing about a minute a day. The battery died after ten days.
customer_reviews.author: Eastern Star

customer_reviews.title: Factory Battery Lasted 2.5 Months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for my son. The battery (SR626SW) needed replacement soon after. As mentioned in other reviews, the strap is not removable and makes it more difficult to replace the battery. The metal used for the watch is not very strong and can get scratched or deformed when removing the back cover. Good first watch, but I probably would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Eats Batteries
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking little watch for my son but the thing eats batteries. We have owned it for a little over a month and it just had it's forth dead battery. I thought maybe we had a bad batch of batteries but the most recent one is a from a different batch that I just bought.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Not just for kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for my elderly mom. She loves watches, but has such a tiny wrist it is hard to find a watch that fits. Also, her hands don't work as good as they use to SO I thought the Velcro strap would be nice for her. I was right. I did a lot of searching to find this watch. Most of the Velcro straps come without the clock. This watch met my expectations. I would have preferred a more feminine-stylish look, but this watch was as described.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Mallard

customer_reviews.title: Nice First Watch for A Boy
customer_reviews.text: Nice little watch. And I do mean little. It looks good on my 9yr old boy, but he wants a bigger one already after only wearing it a year. Probably due to the current style being bigger watches. The velcro is a great feature. I think it is best for boys even though my boy wants a rubber band like one mine. True to being a Timex, it has held up great! His cheap little watches up till now never last more than a few weeks. Good first REAL watch.
customer_reviews.author: BigB71

customer_reviews.title: Spend a bit more to get a better quality item rather than this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 year old son based on some of the comments here and the pictures on the description. But it's certainly not good for someone of that age. It's way smaller than it looks in the pictures and looks really cheap. The band is nice and sturdy though. For around $10 more you can get the Timex Weekender watch which is a much better quality watch for a kid. Also the packaging is horrible. It came in an envelope and as such the box for the watch was totally smashed. And, to top it all off, the item isn't eligible for a return.
customer_reviews.author: James G

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch for Kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday present for my 9 yr old son. He breaks everything but this watch (which he's been wearing almost non-stop) is still in great condition! It's the perfect size for youth and the velcro strap is great - he loves that it doesn't have the metal clasp scratching his wrist. It's a great little watch and I'd definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money, in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: Did not work out of the box. Took it to a jeweler to have the battery replace, assuming that was the problem - cost me $8, and the watch still didn't work. This was purchased as a Christmas gift. Didn't get it to the jeweler and back until after Jan. 31st, which was after the 'allowed' return date, even though the Amazon ad indicated free returns and replacement for lost watches. Wasted money, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: lyn

customer_reviews.title: ... to use at work so I wouldn't damage my good watch. I work with wrenches and outside with ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself to use at work so I wouldn't damage my good watch. I work with wrenches and outside with mud, water and snow. It seems to have held up well. It would be a good first watch for a rough and tough boy or girl. It has a velcro adjustable band and holds the watch well. I have small wrists so it fits me just fine. Only thing I don't like is lint and hair gets stuck to the velcro and dirt gets in the velcro as well and is hard to clean. Overall, I am happy with this watch, it is good for what I intended to use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Battery immediately died.
customer_reviews.text: Watch is great fit and style, but we’ve had it 2 weeks and the battery is dead. Seems difficult to replace due to the strap style.
customer_reviews.author: mom 2 boys

customer_reviews.title: Great first kids watch
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased 3 or 4 of these now for our 2 kids. (more than 2 because he lost a couple....) But 4 and 6 year olds can both put the watch on and off by themselves. Great for teaching time. It's been durable; 2 boys haven't broken one yet. Strap and velcro have held up to their abuse as well.
customer_reviews.author: TonytheTiger

customer_reviews.title: Picture is deceiving.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is much smaller than it appears in the add. I bought it for my 10 yr old grandson but the dial it tiny. It also can't be returned for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: jay baart

customer_reviews.title: Keeping up with an 8 year old
customer_reviews.text: My son is always asking what time it is (he is 8). He knows how to tell time on this watch, he hasn't quite got it down to the exact minute, but this watch has been through some serious adventures. It has been through a few showers, a couple days lost in his own personal jungle and a night in the yard and yet every day it keeps up with him. Love this watch, but not as much as I love the little guy who wears it!
customer_reviews.author: Babs

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but.......
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loved it. The only bad part is that you have to take it to a shop to get the battery changed. It doesn't have the little back that comes off easily with a couple of screws. The battery replacement ends up costing more than the watch. If you could change it yourself, you could buy the battery for $3.
customer_reviews.author: kw

customer_reviews.title: Bad workmanship.
customer_reviews.text: The looks of the wrist watch are okay. And it did fit my daughter's wrist even though her wrist is slim. But as she wore it, the time piece couldn't keep time. I thought it was due to mishandling, so I rested it on the table. It worked adequately. When I handled back the watch, the same phenomenon happened. Too bad I traveled and missed the time interval to return it. Maybe I can reuse the bracelet. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Roberto Lizama

customer_reviews.title: Takes a licking, keeps on ticking
customer_reviews.text: My son is super hard on his stuff, but this has lasted a long time. He actually cracked the glass at one point and it still worked great. He also had gone swimming with it on accidentally and it didn't stop working even though it's not water proof. It was fantastic for a little guy wanting to learn to tell time and was easy to put on/take off. I do wish the band was a little different as after he grew it wasn't quite as comfortable since there isn't a lot of flex with the Velcro.
customer_reviews.author: Bboese

customer_reviews.title: product packaging crushed
customer_reviews.text: Product is'OK' .. the watch is already running like it has been used. not new. and this is a gift to my grandson for kindergarten graduation and the box the watch was packaged in was ripped to shreds.. not only crushed because they put it in an envelope. It was ripped as in half the box torn completely off but also stuffed in the package. I can only image that it was trashed before going into the envelope and they deliberately sent it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Hopester

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 1st watch!!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this watch! The water resistant feature is key, especially for a 7 year old boy. It has been worn in swimming pools, lakes, and under the faucet and still ticks away. The watch itself is very robust and has withstood the rigors of an 8-day backpacking trip; lots of bumping around. There's nothing better for learning to tell time than giving your child an actual tool to do so. My son learned to tell time to the minute in a day and was super proud of himself!
customer_reviews.author: Wade Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Great Product For The Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the price. I bought two of these for my 9 and 11 year old boys to use when leaving the house to visit friends in the neighborhood. Other watches we've bought for them have lasted only a week or so before the batter wears out or the watch is taken apart or broken. So far these are holding up great, and the fact that the watch is analog is encouraging them to improve their time telling skills... Bonus! The velcro band is great also. The boys are quite different in their builds as well as both having sensory processing issues and I've heard no complaints from either of them about comfort.
customer_reviews.author: kate Weatherwax

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Our 7 year-old grandson wanted a "real" watch for his birthday...not a character watch and not a digital one. He was absolutely THRILLED when he opened his gift. The watch has a velcro strap and so it fits most kids. Could not be any more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Debo

customer_reviews.title: This appears to be a fine watch. I bought it for my 8 year ...
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be a fine watch. I bought it for my 8 year old nephew who didn't like it because it "scratched" his wrist. For some reason he just thought the band was not comfortable enough. I thought it was fine. But kids are picky and maybe have more sensitive skin. I couldn't return it because it was beyond the time limit, so I gave it to a friend's son. I didn't hear whether he likes it or not.
customer_reviews.author: Northwest girl

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Time
customer_reviews.text: Here is ANOTHER Timex product I wish I had not purchased. I bought for my son to help him learn how to tell time. He has learned to tell time, however the watch time is always wrong. Changed the battery, still will not keep accurate time. Second new battery, same thing. I thought it may have been him playing with the crown, but I took it from him and looked two days later and it was off by 97 minutes (slow).
customer_reviews.author: Bradlth

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 14yr old son. As soon as he opened it, he loved it. He loves it because he feels the world is losing so much of simple life. He loves that it has hands and numbers. What I loved was the heft is nice! It feels heavy, i like that. The wrist band is easy to adjust and works really well for him since he's got very thin wrists. I figured if he didn't like it, I'd use it because of its simple beauty. But he loves it, so I'll have to get me one now!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Great first watch for a kid!
customer_reviews.text: Great first watch for a kid! My 5 year old wanted a watch like Daddy (i.e., no digital, he wanted analog). I got him this because it has the minutes on it as well as the hours. Unfortunately the minutes numerals are quite small, but on the other hand my son has great eyesight so he can read it - I can't without a magnifying glass. He has learned to tell time and he is quite proud he has a watch like Daddy's. Seems very durable (my son plays in the dirt, woods, rides motorcycles, all with it on).
customer_reviews.author: B. LEW

customer_reviews.title: It's fairly small but still looks like a good size on my 11-year-old son
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive velcro kids' watch. It's fairly small but still looks like a good size on my 11-year-old son. Probably too small for a teenager.
customer_reviews.author: Derek M.

customer_reviews.title: No backlight
customer_reviews.text: In poster advertisement for the watch it clearly states this watch has a backlight. Turns out timed removed this feature and the advertising has not been updated. My son was very disappointed and did not want the watch. Other than being incorrect description It was a nice watch.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Boucher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect watch for kids who have Dress Codes they must meet.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch for younger kids who attend school. It has no "characters" on it, so it meets the dress code where my grandsons go to school. It also is easy to read, which helps young learners actually learn how to tell time. For families on schedules, it is important to teach your children how to be on time, and this is a great tool for that. Also look up the book, "How to Tell Time" that is offered on Amazon.com. It's a great companion to someone's first watch!
customer_reviews.author: Mary-Ann B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 7 year old.
customer_reviews.text: My son is learning to tell time in school and this watch is great for that. My only complaint is that I wish the clock face was slightly bigger so the numbers would be easier to read. Other than that, we love it!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany King

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his watch! I specifically chose an analog watch so he could practice telling time, and it is working well. He wears it all day at school and at play. He likes to ask what time it is a lot so purchasing this watch has given him the capability of checking the time without asking me. I have even overheard people asking him for the time on a few occasions. Very pleased with this watch. It has held up well thus far, and I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: SGJP

customer_reviews.title: Bought twice, broke twice.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this watch twice. The first time was over the summer, and it worked great for three months (on an eight year old's arm). Then, it stopped working. I tried replacing the battery, and that did not fix the problem. So I figured maybe ours was a dud (based on all of the great reviews for this watch) and there didn't seem to be a better or sturdier kid's watch available, so I ordered it again. This time, the glow light never worked and the watch only made it a week before it stopped working! I had thrown away all the guarantee information, assuming that surely I wouldn't get two bad ones in a row.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for teaching time
customer_reviews.text: Great for teaching my little one how to read time. Only wish the numbers in increments of five is slightly bigger so my little one didn't have to put it too close to be able to learn to read the minutes. But so far, good enough for him to read and train on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Z

customer_reviews.title: Loved it but it Stopped working after two months
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this watch so much he sleeps in it. Love the adjustable Velcro strap. The watched stopped working after we had it for 2 months. Not sure if it's a battery or what, but a battery should last longer than 2 months. Son still won't take it off though
customer_reviews.author: RxMomma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Was perfect. The type of attachment was perfect for my son to get on and off by himself. He got it for his 8th birthday and he let me know how much he likes the way it goes on.
customer_reviews.author: DaynaM

customer_reviews.title: 6 year old grandson loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson has been wanting a watch. He’s learning to tell time so I made sure to buy an analog watch to help in the learning process. It has a “grownup” look to it and the Velcro strap makes it easy for him to put on and take off with ease and adjust for a good fit. It’s a great size for a 6 year old. He’s wore it everyday since his birthday and is really proud of it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Thanks to the velcro strap it is easy to adjust as necessary to sit snuggly on his ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for my 8yr old son and it fits him perfectly. Thanks to the velcro strap it is easy to adjust as necessary to sit snuggly on his wrist. Being a slender boy he needed to pull the velcro quite a bit but there is more than enough to meet his needs. The watch itself is nice and both watch and strap feels sturdy and well made. As far as its water resistance quality, we are yet to do anything to test that. With that in mind, so far I am quite pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kearn M.

customer_reviews.title: Adult with small wrist.
customer_reviews.text: I can't wear most adult watches because my wrist are small. Being an older adult I don't want a kiddy looking watch. This one is perfect. It looks nice. It's comfortable. It holds time perfect. It's easy on and off. I feel it's perfect for kids that are not little anymore and want something more grown up and is perfect for adults with small wrist like me. The price is perfect too. :)
customer_reviews.author: Shanti

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, great guarantee from Timex.
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch! Was bought as a replacement for a cheap-o kids' watch that broke very easily. This one seems to be durable. Plus, it came with a guarantee from Timex: they'll replace it once in the first year, no questions asked, if something happens to it. My 5-year-old has very small wrists, and this fits him when it's tightened all the way. But it would fit much bigger kids, for sure...probably even an adult. My kiddo loves that he can make this light up at night, and I think it's helped him learn to tell time. The numbers showing the minutes are tiny, but they're there.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Durable watch. Great gift option!
customer_reviews.text: Son loved it. This was a Christmas present last year because seriously how many more Legos does a kid really need? In school they are being taught to tell time the proper way and I thought this would be a great educational gift. It's great option for kids to have a real watch and learn to tell time. He's had it for nearly a year and it's still going strong! The light glows green when the button on the side is held down, which makes it fun too.
customer_reviews.author: Knc

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, great price
customer_reviews.text: My 7-year-old has been wearing this watch pretty much non-stop for the past month, to school, sports, play, outdoor activities, and it's held up beautifully. Easy to take on and off, easy to read the numbers (he's gotten way better at telling time - it's nice that it has the corresponding minute number next to the big numbers to help him learn), sturdy, nice sporty look. The Indiglo light-up face is his favorite feature! Price was low enough that I wouldn't feel too bad if he lost or broke it (seeing as that seems to happen a lot with 7yos), and Timex's $10 replacement deal makes it even better. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after only 1 month :(
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a great watch, and my son loved it. But it has just stopped working after less than one month of use. I love the look of the watch and the strap is very comfortable and durable. I just think a product like this should last much longer than a month.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Mackert

customer_reviews.title: ten stars
customer_reviews.text: Both my boys have been wearing these constantly for several years without incident. Actually, we had two incidents, neither the fault of the watch - one involving a very large rock, and one involving a dead battery (turned out that my son was using the backlight to read in bed, under the covers, 'til midnight - easily replaced). We just got a call from the local pool, where one watch spent the day at the bottom of the deep end - it's still fine. These truly take a lickin' and keep on tickin'. Plus, they're the only nice-looking watch for kids that we've been able to find. No camo, no Sponge Bob, just a watch that works.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Fiddaman

customer_reviews.title: Was just as I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was hoping for for my grandson's first watch. The size is perfect. Only problem is the box was torn which was disappointing since it is a gift. I was also hoping for a nicer box.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Jane

customer_reviews.title: Classic first watch!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect first watch. My son is 6 and this fits his wrist nicely with adjustable Velcro strap. Face is easy to see/read. Classic look. Ideal for learning to tell time.
customer_reviews.author: Family of shoppers

customer_reviews.title: It even held up in a pretty good bike wipeout
customer_reviews.text: This watch is the third one we tried for our 12 year old, the other two lasted only a few weeks before meeting a violent demise. This watch is worn often and in play, biking, and general 12 year old running around. So far it has lasted very well, and the velcro band has also held up well. It even held up in a pretty good bike wipeout. Note - I cannot provide feedback on water resiliency, also it's lasted though many handwashings. I'd say this is a good bet for a first watch that you don't expect to be treated gently.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Taylor

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FIRST "REAL" WATCH FOR A CHILD
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my 7-year old son's first "real" watch. It's perfect for him -- "kid" sized, with a Velcro strap that fits perfectly every time, and a straight-forward face with hour, minute, and second hands. It has really helped him learn to tell time quickly, and to have a better concept of units of time. As a matter of fact, now he enjoys timing all sorts of things. And it seems rugged enough to handle whatever a 7-year old can throw at it.
customer_reviews.author: Mo H.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Watch
customer_reviews.text: Great for helping to teach your child how to read and analog clock. Love the ease of the velcro strap. My son struggles with trying to put on a standard watch strap and needs help but not with this one. Watch runs well.
customer_reviews.author: BusyMom

customer_reviews.title: it has held up pretty good for about 3 months now
customer_reviews.text: Overall, my 8 year old son hasn't broken it. That says something. However, it consistently runs fast. He has to adjust the time about once a week. He regularly checks his watch against mine and then fixes the time. Other than that, physically, it has held up pretty good for about 3 months now. I am pretty disappointed that a quartz watch can't keep time for a week. This is the primary reason for the two stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Fielding

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: For my 8 and 9 year old Christmas 2011 this was their first REAL watch. I threw this in sort of as an afterthought with the toys. They are both wearing their watches every day and are much more involved in timing things, being aware of what happens when. The watches haven't missed a beat. Pros Accurate so far Mineral face More attractive in person than the picture Light weight easy to wear Comfortable rugged band. Indiglo for $15? Timex says they will replace for $10 if lost in the first year. Get your kid a real watch for the price of a junk disposable watch from Walleyworld with a cartoon on the front.
customer_reviews.author: clearanceman

customer_reviews.title: Kids size
customer_reviews.text: This watch is definitely kids size. Appropriate for up to 11. It is smaller than the picture shows but will look right in a kids arm. Be aware that the Timex box is thin cardboard. I received mine in a bubble envelope which DID NOT protect the box. It is supposed to be a gift, now I have to figure out a way to repackage it to present it as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great little watch
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little watch. I purchased it for my 4 year old grandson who keeps wanting to know what time it is on my watch which does not have numbers so I felt this watch would help ,especially for the price. The Velcro band makes it possible to have it fit his little wrist. There is a little too much Velcro band left when he puts it on, but it doesn't bother him. He fixes it himself. This is certainly no baby watch.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene P. Damelia

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect watch for an elementary-aged child. My older kids have been frustrated with the regular watch bands, and this velcro is not bulky and eliminates the frustration kids may have when putting on/taking off watches. Further, it has a replacement guarantee, no questions asked. Timex was on to something because my oldest lost his watch within two weeks, and he really liked it, so we replaced it. We will be buying more for the younger kids, too.
customer_reviews.author: Z-Ro

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My four year old LOVE LOVE LOVE this watch, he's been wearing it for over 6 months now, and still tells everyone he meets about his watch. It's water resistant, and very durable (surviving a four year old is no small feat). And I am teaching him time with it, he now understand what the little hand and big hand mean. I am really glad of this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Yunlin Xiao

customer_reviews.title: This is definitely one of the best purchases we've ever made for our boys
customer_reviews.text: We gave this watch to my son for his 9th birthday, and after a year and a half of daily use, this watch is still going strong. The crown isn't all shiny silver anymore and the Velcro band is worn in places, but it's been through swimming pools, mud puddles, woodland hikes, bike wrecks, summer camp, and just about anything else an active boy can get into. Our younger son just got one of these watches in his stocking, and I expect it to hold up as well as his brother's. This is definitely one of the best purchases we've ever made for our boys.
customer_reviews.author: WhitneyWill03

customer_reviews.title: Minute numbers to aid with telling time!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for my grandson because of the minute numbers to help him with telling time, but the numbers are so small, he couldn't see them, so if you're buying this watch with the same mindset as mine, don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Alma Davis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for my just-turned 5 year old son
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for my just-turned 5 year old son! However the clock was not running when we took tbout of the box. And it is not possible to change the battery at home. My husband managed to pry back the back of the watch and fix the battery but had to use pliers to get the back on again. And that damaged the face of the watch. My son doesn't seem to notice or mind though so it's okay.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Short Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this watch in late 2016. Battery died in early 2020. So much for "up to 10 year battery life". Tried to put a new battery in (and own tools specifically designed for this purpose) but the construction was so cheap that it was literally impossible to replace the battery without the watch breaking. Maybe a professional could have pulled it off but that would have cost more than the watch.
customer_reviews.author: outsidethebox studio

customer_reviews.title: Excellent First Watch for A Boy
customer_reviews.text: The watch looks to be well made and durable enough for a young boy to have as his first watch. The watch itself is small enough to fit on a small boy's wrist, yet large enough to easily view the numbers and the hands, including the second hand. The Velcro strap is particularly nice as it is not only infinitely adjustable, it is also very easy to take loosen and secure, yet it will not accidentally come off. The watch is water resistant to 30 meters. Only time will tell how well it will hold up...my son has only had the watch for a week now.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Best real watch for preschoolers/toddlers alike!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my 5 year old boy for christmas and he loved it so much. He thinks it's super cool. The time works for real so it's not a toy. It's sturdy and it's been working pretty well for over a year now. We really like it and might buy another one for his younger brother as they tend not to share. I also had bought it for my 8 year old nephew. He loved it, too!
customer_reviews.author: Debra B.

customer_reviews.title: Bought two, one for each kid, and they love them!
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect size and fit for small wrists. They are also unisex, and go with pretty much everything. We purchased one for each of our children, aged 8 & 9. They love the illuminating face, and the simple, easy-to-read fuss-free design of this watch. I suspect they will have them for years to come. My only "complaint" -- and it's a minor one -- is that the silver part around the face is a tad decorative (i.e. girly) for a very boyish boy. I think he wishes it were plain. But as I say, this is barely worth mentioning -- he wears it all the time so he's not overly bothered!
customer_reviews.author: Sequin

customer_reviews.title: A really nice watch for a child!
customer_reviews.text: I've looked for quite a while for a toy watch for a little boy, but when I found this real one, it was great! It is not expensive, it's sturdy and seems like it will take some abuse, and the velcro wrist band is easy for him to use. It is adjustable and fits his small wrist, and will fit as he grows. That's assuming it lasts, but I think it will, and he is thrilled to have a "real" watch. It will help him learn to tell the time quickly!
customer_reviews.author: J Quinlan

customer_reviews.title: i bought the first one from amazon and the stupid thing would never keep correct time
customer_reviews.text: i bought the first one from amazon and the stupid thing would never keep correct time, it looks great but not worth a nickel if it looses several hours in a day. I also bought another one same brand and type from a reputable store thinking that the first one was defective it also had the same problem, would not keep correct time. So my advise don't buy this junk Im so dissatisfied with timex. I had one when I was a kid and it lasted forever. I guess the made in china crap is truly junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great watch for my 7 year old
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old loves this watch, and he can work the band without help. This is an upgrade for him from the Times Kids Lizard elastic band watch  Although the lizard watch was easier to put on when he was younger (he has worn that one since he was 6) the two lizards on the second hand made learning to tell time trickier. This new watch has a plain, easy to read face and has indiglo. I would recommend it to anyone with kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works but it will not take much punishment
customer_reviews.text: I wanted my son to have a watch but no digital, not until he was very good at reading an analog clock, good enough there was little to no hesitation. Well, it works well for that but he is a boy and this watch is not very durable...I did not expect it to last forever but the surface is very easy to scratch. I think if I did it over again I would still buy it as I did not see reasonably priced alternatives but if I bought it again I would have a more realistic expectation that this is a very short term device, to learn and then toss in the garbage and get a much higher quality watch.
customer_reviews.author: CraigG

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great watch for the price. Well built and my son loves it. Word of warning though: if you your child gets a nervous habit of doing and undoing the velcro, the velcro will eventually stop sticking. :) Not a product flaw. But a good opportunity to work with our children to find more productive ways of expelling energy.
customer_reviews.author: WJMDT93

customer_reviews.title: Timex Kids' T79051 "My First Timex"
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for 10 year old boy. The Velcro wristband is easy for kids to get on and off, and it will hold up better to wear and tear than a traditional wristband. The watch face itself is small and perfectly proportional to a kids wrist. It is also a very simple watch - no bells and whistles. In my opinion, it is perfect for a kid around 10 years old, and the one I bought it for as a Christmas present loved it (and is still wearing it everyday over a month later!).
customer_reviews.author: rSquare

customer_reviews.title: BEST WATCH FOR KIDS
customer_reviews.text: BEST WATCH I HAVE BOUGHT FOR MY KIDS! I have spent countless dollars and watches for my boys but they seem to enjoy these best. First, I love that it is not digital so they can practice telling time like they teach at school. Secondy, the Velcro strap allows them to take the watch on and off without assistance. Third, it has a light on it so at night they can check the time (they think it is cool)! You won't be disappointed with this purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: HTT

customer_reviews.title: When your done with juvenile watches
customer_reviews.text: This is the best watch I have found for my 9 year old child. I bought him one last year and recently purchased another in case he loses it. Most children's watches are too juvenile after a certain age and this one is like any adult watch. The velcro band is easy off and on for a kid and dries quickly if it gets wet. He has thin wrists and this is comfortably adjustable to fit him and will for many years. It fits me. It also has the push button light. My expensive watch doesn't even have that. He thinks this watch makes him look older and cool.
customer_reviews.author: dcbookie

customer_reviews.title: Great starter watch
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful sturdy and simple looking first watches! My sons are only five, but they are both on the autism spectrum and being able to tell time is important to them and helps them cope with activities and schedules. These are great little watches so far and not cartoonish or busy on the watch face, which is something I was really looking to avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Great first watch
customer_reviews.text: My 8-year old son loved it. It was probably his favorite Christmas gift. He wanted a watch just like dad, except without the Roman numerals. More educational than a digital watch, it also has a very easy adjustable band that velcros. The face is also the perfect size for smaller wrists. The only thing he wishes it had was the luminous hands and numbers so he could read it in the dark. After a couple days it hasn't lost any time. Time will tell how accurate it is and how long the battery lasts...
customer_reviews.author: Jim DiLorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Kids watch for an adult
customer_reviews.text: Watch arrived on time. Nothing wrong with packaging. I am an adult female with a 5 1/2 inch wrist. Most adult watches end up twisting outward on me. The leather and faux leather bands stretch after time and I end up having to punch another hole in the band to keep it tight. This fits snugly, right where I put it. Quite comfortable. I also tend to be allergic to the backings on many watches. Since the cloth sits between my skin and the watch, I don't experience the reaction! So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie A

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great watch! Bought it for my son's 9th birthday since he's been wanting a "real" watch. Fits him great. Easy to take off and put on. He's so proud of it. Sadly, he let his 2 treat old brother wear it, unknown to me, and it was lost just today. We ran a few errands and it got left behind somewhere. Called the places we were at and no one has seen it. It's not even a month old for him. He received it on Halloween. I'll eventually order him a new one, after Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: SpiderLizz

customer_reviews.title: Great little watch
customer_reviews.text: I wish it would come in more colors! I wanted to buy a watch for my daughter, who is 3.5 and getting quite interested in time. I wanted something with big numbers and no distractions like princesses or butterflies on the hands. This seemed like the only option. The strap is a little too long for her, but we make it work. She loves having her own watch, I have taken pictures of different times like bed-time, lunch-time etc. so she can learn.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: this watch no longer has the indiglo light up feature which my son loved. We bought this 3 years ago and when ...
customer_reviews.text: reviewers are right, this watch no longer has the indiglo light up feature which my son loved. We bought this 3 years ago and when it stopped working I ordered another for his birthday with no idea that it wasn't the same light up design. Very disappointed that they changed this feature and that it was his big birthday present which ended up being not as good as his previous. Shame on you timex, what was wrong with a great watch for boys that you had to remove a favourite feature?
customer_reviews.author: FMW35

customer_reviews.title: Watch stopped.
customer_reviews.text: The watch has to be durable and reliable from normal daily use, while it's for kids. It's purchased for my 6-year-old son for his birthday. He liked the style and the Velcro feature by which he can wear it on his own. I liked them also. But after using about 2 and half months, the watch stopped. It won't be the battery, because first it's new and second the indigo glow light is still on. I don't know how to deal with this, since Amazon does not allow me to return since the time window is expired.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than those cheap plastic character watches by far
customer_reviews.text: This watch is a good price and much better quality than all those plastic character ones geared towards children. Easy to see numbers and the velcro is holding up. The velcro allows for adjustability which is great for growing kiddos. Originally given to my 8 year old and it fits his wrist just fine. I had to borrow it because my watch broke and it fit my wrist also.
customer_reviews.author: Kaila

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last a month
customer_reviews.text: Brought it and gave it to my son for his 8th birthday. One week of wearing it we had to spend $15 to replace the battery. A week later the watch won't keep time. And now the time is up to return it. Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great grown up looking watch
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old son wanted a grown up looking watch but his wrist is too slender for an adult watch. All the ones at the store were cartoon characters or too juvenile. We found this here for $14 shipped and he couldn't be happier with his purchase (he saved his money). The adjustable Velcro strap ensures a good fit even on his skinny wrists and I'm sure it could fit a much larger wrist. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: NCFLmom

customer_reviews.title: On our third one; they get lost faster than they wear out!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the first one for my son when he was 5. He's now six and has managed to lose two while changing for swimming lessons. The watch is great - fits his little tiny wrist pretty well, band stays on thru soccer and rough-housing and gym, clock keeps pretty accurate time and the numbers and hands are big enough for him to see & learn to tell time. Lens/cover/crystal can take a good beating. Now, if we can only learn how to keep track of the thing while changing with 40 other little boys.....reckon I'll just get two next time they're in stock.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Stainless Steel Kids Watch Timex
customer_reviews.text: Great watch, nice fit, durable. A rugged type of watch and the velcro really helps fit snugly for a small wrist. Very pleased with this purchase. Update to my original review: For some reason, this watch keeps losing a pin that holds it together onto the band. I have purchased additional pins put them on myself and even took it to a jeweler and had him put it in. A week later out it comes again. Don't know how the manufacturer can fix it, but it is a real problem!!
customer_reviews.author: Sheri C.

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, Lousy packaging
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch for everyday. My wrist is small so this boys watch fits perfectly. However, the watch was running when I received it so very disappointed that the battery is probably pretty much gone.
customer_reviews.author: Cincy Grandmother

customer_reviews.title: Nice look and durable quality
customer_reviews.text: This has held up well to my 8 year old so far. He takes care of his things, but wears his watch everyday so it has withstood falls, sports, and the playground! He loves it, always telling me what time it is and monitoring how many minutes he has to bedtime. I love that there are minute numbers too. They helped him when he was learning, but they don't overpower the look of the watch. Overall this is worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Sarazahh

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: I am actually a 67 year old woman and I first purchased this watch for my grandson. He decided he wanted a bigger watch so I took this one. I love it because I have a very small wrist and this watch fits me perfectly. I love that it is analog and not digital. Very easy to change time when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old son really likes it. Great size for his arm, easy to put on and take off. Clean, clear, readable dial.
customer_reviews.author: TylerG

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is.
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is. An affordable kids watch at a cheap price. However I was a bit disappointed as I thought the dial would be a bit bigger and more legible so a kid could easily read it to practice learning to tell time being it is their first watch.
customer_reviews.author: Jay B

customer_reviews.title: WORKED GREAT FOR 2.5 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch for the "little man" in your life. My son wore it faithfully each day for 2 1/2 months until it stopped working. In our case, the little "dial" at the right of the watch fell off. When I contacted Timex customer service, I was told the watch could be mailed in, and this small piece replaced for a cost of $8.00. That does not seem like a good gamble on a $15.00 watch. At our rate, it would cost us us $72.00 to keep this model watch on his wrist - working - for one year. :(
customer_reviews.author: HAPPYMAMA

customer_reviews.title: I don't like leaving negative feedback
customer_reviews.text: I don't like leaving negative feedback, but we thought we were purchasing a quality watch for our 7 year old son. Unfortunately, one of the main reasons we wanted it was for the Indiglo feature, and when it arrived, it did not even have that. Amazon replaced it, but the second one was the same. We decided to go ahead and keep it. It has lasted 4 months, with the batteries replaced twice and now won't work at all. Very disappointing for Timex brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jeana

customer_reviews.title: Great kids watch
customer_reviews.text: A watch with hands was suggested by my son's teacher to help him manage his time better. This has a simple, quickly read face. The Velcro is easier for him to manage than a tiny buckle and it is sized appropriately so it isn't too big. We found many "toy" watches with characters obscuring the face or with snap together pieces, but those would have been too distracting at school. My only wish was that it came in other colors besides black, especially because my daughter now wants one too.
customer_reviews.author: freelancer and mom

customer_reviews.title: The perfect first watch for an active child.....
customer_reviews.text: .......or anyone with a smaller wrist. It has a very convenient and easy to use Velcro wristband that easily adjusts to each person's version of perfect. I can attest to this as I bought it for my very particular 8 year old grandson. He gives it a thumbs up and wears it every day. He can get it off and on by himself, something important when personal independence is a new and wonderful thing. This watch is built tough and should hold up well under the demands of school-yard play.
customer_reviews.author: ACeeKayWa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My son is pretty thin and has a tiny wrist so we love the Velcro band.
customer_reviews.author: LadyT530

customer_reviews.title: 7 year old son LOVES it
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 2nd grade son and he LOVES it. He's so proud to wear it. He even shows it off to his friends at school (who have digital watches, and they like his better!) He likes how it fits him - its very comfortable. He also likes the velcro and he can put it on himself. I kinda wish we had gotten it sooner just as he started learning how to tell time!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy M Stein

customer_reviews.title: 3 year old loves this watch
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this watch. He can take it off and put it on all by himself and he is only 3. He did not like the other "kid" watches as he wanted one that looked like his "dads" and not toyish.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Our second one but we still love it.
customer_reviews.text: Our second one but we still love it. My 8 year old son had one for about two years until it conked out. He loves it though, it's easy to read, nice looking, comfortable and easy to get on and off, so we got another. I don't think it's waterproof so we try to be careful around pool and shower. Hoping to get a little more life out of the second.
customer_reviews.author: Tobert

customer_reviews.title: Have bought two or three of these...
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old son loves wearing a watch, and he loves this watch! His first one held up for months until he was skateboarding and fell right onto his wrist, cracking the face. (Incidentally, the watch still worked fine.). He then lost the second one and we are now on number three. He really likes it so much that he won't consider a different style. It is just the right size for a kid, the velcro is easy to fasten and stays on tightly, he loves the indiglo and he can get it wet without any problems. My only complaint is that I wish it came in some other colors or styles.
customer_reviews.author: A. Derrico

customer_reviews.title: It's a keeper
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! I purchased the black for my 11 yr old son and the turquoise for my 9 yr old daughter and they both love them. The black is cool enough for an 11 yr old but lightweight and easy to put on. The turquoise is perfect for my unique spirited daughter who hates pink and purple. After going through several Lego watches that have fallen apart, I'm really hoping these will last a little longer. And the price is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S. LeCerf

product_meta.title: Timex Kids My First Outdoors Watch
product_meta.description:
Once upon a time children were proud to tell time on their own. This just-for-kids watch will help them on their way, so they can live happily ever after…and on time.




PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :3.5 x 0.25 x 3 inches; 0.8 Ounces
 * Item model number :T79051
 * Department :Unisex-children
 * Batteries :1 Product Specific batteries required. (included)
 * Date First Available :August 6, 2003
 * Manufacturer :Timex
 * ASIN :B000SZPZV6

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #45,598 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry)  *  #45 inBoys' Wrist Watches 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.1 out of 5 stars1,519 ratings Once upon a time children were proud to tell time on their own. This just-for-kids watch will help them on their way, so they can live happily ever after…and on time.
feature_bullets: Adjustable nylon Fast Wrap strap with hook & loop fastener fits up to 6-inch wrist circumference
White easy-to-read dial with full Arabic numerals
Water resistant to 30m (100ft): in general, withstands splashes or brief immersion in water, but not suitable for swimming or bathing
